alert.note: Alert for Franklin (Massachusetts) Issued by the National Weather Service

info.headline: Flood Warning issued July 10 at 10:07PM EDT until July 11 at 3:12PM EDT by NWS Boston
info.description: ...The Flood Warning continues for the following rivers in Massachusetts...Connecticut... Connecticut River At Montague affecting Hampshire and Franklin Counties. Connecticut River Below Holyoke affecting Hampden County. Connecticut River At Northampton affecting Hampshire and Hampden Counties. Connecticut River ABOVE Holyoke Dam affecting Hampden County. Connecticut River At Thompsonville affecting Hampden and Hartford Counties. Connecticut River At Hartford affecting Middlesex and Hartford Counties. Farmington River At Simsbury affecting Hartford County. ...The Flood Warning is extended for the following rivers in Massachusetts... Deerfield At Charlemont affecting Berkshire and Franklin Counties. West Deerfield River AT West Deerfield affecting Franklin County. For the Connecticut River...including Montague, Northampton, Holyoke Dam, Holyoke, Springfield, Thompsonville, Hartford, Middle Haddam... Moderate flooding is forecast. For the Farmington River...including Unionville, Simsbury, Tariffville...Minor flooding is forecast. For the Deerfield River...including Charlemont, West Deerfield... Moderate flooding is forecast. ...FLOOD WARNING NOW IN EFFECT UNTIL TOMORROW AFTERNOON... * WHAT...Minor flooding is forecast. * WHERE...West Deerfield River at West Deerfield. * WHEN...Until tomorrow afternoon. * IMPACTS...At 11.0 feet, Portions of Stillwater Rd near I-91, Pogues Hole Rd, Round Pond Rd and Broughams Pond Rd are inundated. Floodwaters encroach on Little Meadow Rd. Also lowest lying recreational fields and some adjacent parking lots close to the Deerfield River are inundated. Flooding occurs along farmland and some farm houses close to the Deerfield River. * ADDITIONAL DETAILS... - At 9:46 PM EDT Monday the stage was 8.3 feet. - Bankfull stage is 25.0 feet. - Forecast...The river is expected to rise above flood stage late this evening to a crest of 11.0 feet just after midnight tonight. It will then fall below flood stage late tomorrow morning. - Flood stage is 9.0 feet. - Flood History...This crest compares to a previous crest of 10.9 feet on 10/20/1989. - http://www.weather.gov/safety/flood &&
info.instruction: Caution is urged when walking near riverbanks. Turn around, don`t drown when encountering flooded roads. Most flood deaths occur in vehicles. Motorists should not attempt to drive around barricades or drive cars through flooded areas. Additional information is available at www.weather.gov. The next statement will be issued Tuesday morning at 1015 AM EDT.
